events.name: Disney On Ice - Dream Big

promoters.name: LIVE NATION (MUSIC) UK LTD (VENUES)
promoters.description: LIVE NATION (MUSIC) UK LTD (VENUES) / NTL / GBR

events.pleaseNote: Under 14s must be accompanied by an adult over 18. Kids UNDER 2 are free if they sit on a parent's lap. All Kids 2 and older must purchase a ticket. A max of 8 tickets per person and per household applies. Tickets in excess of 8 will be cancelled.

ticketLimit.info: Please note: There is a ticket limit of 8 ticket per person and per credit card on this event

venues.name: Utilita Arena Cardiff

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Ticketmaster UK: 0870 154 40 40 International: +44 161 385 3500 Venue box office: 02920 224 488 Email: cardiff.boxoffice@livenation.co.uk
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: Monday - Friday: 10:00 to 16:00
boxOfficeInfo.acceptedPaymentDetail: Amex, Mastercard, Visa (credit and debit), Switch/Maestro, cash, cheques (with guarantee card)
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Collect from the venue on the day of the show from one hour before doors open. Take the credit card used to make the booking and Ticketmaster reference number with you. The cardholder will be required to sign for the tickets. No duplicate tickets will be issued for any standing shows at this venue.

venues.parkingDetail: Available at NCP multi-storey car parks around venue. Please visit http://www.ncp.co.uk/ for up to date information regarding available parking in and around Cardiff. The postcode for Utilita Arena Cardiff is CF10 2EQ
venues.accessibleSeatingDetail: The venue is accessible to disabled patrons. Please contact the venue on 02920 234 509 for further information or you can email cardiff.boxoffice@livenation.co.uk

generalInfo.generalRule: Standard compact cameras and taking photos on your phone are fine. Professional/long lens cameras, selfie sticks, video cameras, ipads (tablets) and go-pros are permitted and will be confiscated. No food or drink items can be brought into the venue. However, there are concessions inside the venue from where food and drinks can be purchased. Live Nation reserves the right to allow audience members to stand in seated areas of the venue. No standing on seats within the arena is permitted.
generalInfo.childRule: It is recommended that under 14 should be accompanied by an adult. Customers wishing to purchase a ticket for a baby are advised to contact the venue prior to booking. A "baby" is defined as a child under two years old, too young to be able to sit on a seat or to walk. All other children will require a paid ticket (and seat).

ada.adaPhones:
For further information on Utilita Arena Cardiff's Access facilities:
Please e-mail cardiff.boxoffice@livenation.co.uk
ada.adaCustomCopy:
The venue's full inventory of tickets, including accessible tickets, are available online at www.ticketmaster.co.uk.

Please select the required Accessible Ticket from the Accessible Tickets list and then select the required seat from the options displayed on the seating map.

By purchasing an Accessible ticket online, you confirm that you, or a member of your party require Accessible tickets. Proof of eligibility (Personal Independence Payment, Disability Living Allowance, Carers/Attendance Allowance, Letter from a medical professional etc) must be provided prior to the event and forwarded to Ticketmaster as requested.  Bookings may be cancelled if tickets are requested without the eligibility criteria being met.

Upon arrival patrons should go to the box office and will be directed to the venue's dedicated customer service team.

Please note:
• Accessible tickets can sell out very quickly and we recommend purchasing your tickets as soon as an event has gone on sale.
• Companion / carer tickets are subject to availability and are allocated at the time of purchase and must be added with the  accompanied paid Accessible ticket.

• Companions only available on specific Accessible allocation.

• Unfortunately, the venue is unable to issue Companion / Carer tickets to ticket holders purchasing from third party outlets.

By placing your order, you confirm you have read these terms & agree to be bound by them. You should save a copy of these terms for future reference. The venue reserves the right to refuse admission or eject customers in reasonable circumstances and may on occasion have to conduct security searches to ensure the safety of customers. Customers should note that they may be refused entry or ejected from the venue on account of being (or appearing to be) underage (where relevant), abusive, threatening, drunken, declining to be searched, carrying offensive weapons or illegal substances or for any other anti-social behaviour. No refunds will be offered to customers who are refused entry or ejected in such circumstances.
events.pleaseNote: Level 3 is accessible by stairs only. Levels 2 & 3 may not suit those who have mobility difficulties or who are uncomfortable with heights.

products.name: Disney on Ice: OVO Live Lounge Access

accessibility.info:
Wheelchair positions are for wheelchair users.

'Ambulant' positions are for patrons with disabilities/conditions that are unable to use general arena seating/standing.

Patrons requiring a hearing induction system or other services (BSL/Audio Description etc) should call the venue on 0141 576 3230 for more information.

The accessible ticket policy limits one free carer ticket to each accessible ticket purchased. If you need more than one essential companion or additional positions in your booking, please call the venue on 0141 576 3230.

By purchasing an accessible ticket, you confirm you or a member of your party require this position. Proof of eligibility/disability must be provided before the event - you will be contacted by Ticketmaster no later than 72 hours after your order.

Tickets may be cancelled if misuse is suspected/found.
accessibility.urlText: For further information on The OVO Hydro's accessible facilities please visit

venues.name: OVO Hydro

boxOfficeInfo.phoneNumberDetail: Accessible tickets can be booked online, or you can call 0141 576 3230 (replaces 0800 952 0110 temporarily) (open Mon-Fri 9am-2pm). Need help with your order? If you booked online via Ticketmaster, you can view their help section here or access 24hr support for specific orders in your online account. More information about how to access your online account is available here. If you booked over the phone, or in person with SEC, please email booking.enquiries@sec.co.uk or use our contact page
boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box office opens at 3pm on the day of the event and closes 15 mins after the main act takes to stage, unless otherwise stated. Tickets can be purchased online 24 hours a day at www.ovohydro.com (powered by Ticketmaster).
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets can be collected from the SEC Centre box office on the day of the event from the advertised doors opening time. Please take the payment card used to make the booking and your Ticketmaster reference number The OVO Hydro box office opens one hour before doors to the arena opens and closes 30 minutes after the main act starts or at the end of the interval, unless otherwise stated.

venues.parkingDetail: A multi-storey car park operated by Glasgow City Council is available for OVO Hydro visitors. Onsite pay machines are on the ground floor, or level 2 (walkway level) of the car park. Payment can be made by cash or credit/debit card on arrival or before departure. Further information is available from the operator's website. The multi-storey has a height restriction of 2.0m. Drop-Off, Pick-Up Point An OVO Hydro drop-off/pick-up zone is located at the west of SEC Centre. A map to this is available on the OVO Hydro website. The drop-off/pick-up zone runs an accessible transfer service to the OVO Hydro, dropping off within 130m of The OVO Hydro south main entrance.
venues.accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible tickets are available to book online, but for larger or more complex groups, please call our dedicated accessible booking line on 0141 576 3230 (replaces 0800 952 0110 temporarily). The venue is easily accessible for visitors with mobility difficulties and accessible needs and currently holds an Attitude is Everything Gold award for access. The first two floors of OVO Hydro are fully accessible with lifts and automated doors. Important: There is no lift to the 3rd and final floor of the venue, there are stairs along with handrail assistance to gain access to this floor. Please take this into consideration when booking tickets. People with mobility issues are recommended to book tickets on the ground, level 1 or level 2 front, as these have lifts to access. All Entry doors East, South and West into the Hydro are wide for easy access. Broad, flat, accessible concourse The venue has multiple accessible toilets and one fully equipped Changing Place with ceiling hoist, changing bed and height adjustable basin. Entry is by RADAR key visitors can use their own or ask a steward to unlock for them. The venue offers a wide range of additional accessibility services, such as sunflower lanyards, sensory packs, infra-red induction loop, etc. For more information visit the venue website at www.ovohydro.com

generalInfo.generalRule: The following policies apply to most events, but each event may differ, so please check the venue website event page for specific event policies. For full details of all venue policies see the venue website FAQs page. Searching and security All bags and visitors may be searched when entering the venue. Bags larger than A3 size (30cm x 42cm) are not permitted. Age Policies/Restrictions It is the recommendation of the venue that children under fourteen should not attend in the standing area at any event, unless accompanied by an adult. All patrons over five years old are welcome to attend in the seated section, unless otherwise stated by the event organiser. It is the venue's recommendation that children under five should not attend concerts or events, other than those specifically aimed at younger visitors, i.e. children's shows. Unless otherwise stated by the event organiser, the standard venue age advisory will apply. Exit and Re-Entry You may leave and re-enter the venue during the event, as long as you present your ticket for scanning each time. Cameras In general audio and video recording equipment and professional cameras (SLR types and those with detachable lenses) are not permitted into events. However, small non-professional cameras and phone cameras may be permitted, unless otherwise specified by the event organiser. Special Effects Special effects are used at many events and are controlled by the touring production team. If the use of certain effects concern you, or you would like further information on effects that may be used at a specific show, please email the venue. Other restrictions No food, drink, bottles or cans can be brought into the venue, other than for medical purposes (proof of need may be required). Please note that Level 2 rear and level 3 is accessible by stairs only and may not be suitable for those with mobility difficulties. May not be suitable for those who experience difficulty with heights or vertigo.
generalInfo.childRule: All children must have a valid ticket for an event, with the exception of 'babes in arms' (under 12 months) who may sit on a parent/guardian's knee, unless otherwise stated by the event promoter. Please check the age restrictions for each show. We have a small number of booster seats available to borrow for events in The OVO Hydro and SEC Armadillo. These are allocated on a first come first served basis and may be fully allocated at popular family events. If a booster seat is essential to your visit, we would encourage you to bring your own to avoid disappointment.

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The Box office opens at 3pm on the day of the event and closes 15 mins after the main act takes to stage, unless otherwise stated. Tickets can be purchased online 24 hours a day at www.ovohydro.com (powered by Ticketmaster).
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: Tickets can be collected from the SEC Centre box office on the day of the event from the advertised doors opening time. Please take the payment card used to make the booking and your Ticketmaster reference number The OVO Hydro box office opens one hour before doors to the arena opens and closes 30 minutes after the main act starts or at the end of the interval, unless otherwise stated.

venues.parkingDetail: A multi-storey car park operated by Glasgow City Council is available for OVO Hydro visitors. Onsite pay machines are on the ground floor, or level 2 (walkway level) of the car park. Payment can be made by cash or credit/debit card on arrival or before departure. Further information is available from the operator's website. The multi-storey has a height restriction of 2.0m. Drop-Off, Pick-Up Point An OVO Hydro drop-off/pick-up zone is located at the west of SEC Centre. A map to this is available on the OVO Hydro website. The drop-off/pick-up zone runs an accessible transfer service to the OVO Hydro, dropping off within 130m of The OVO Hydro south main entrance.
venues.accessibleSeatingDetail: Accessible tickets are available to book online, but for larger or more complex groups, please call our dedicated accessible booking line on 0141 576 3230 (replaces 0800 952 0110 temporarily). The venue is easily accessible for visitors with mobility difficulties and accessible needs and currently holds an Attitude is Everything Gold award for access. The first two floors of OVO Hydro are fully accessible with lifts and automated doors. Important: There is no lift to the 3rd and final floor of the venue, there are stairs along with handrail assistance to gain access to this floor. Please take this into consideration when booking tickets. People with mobility issues are recommended to book tickets on the ground, level 1 or level 2 front, as these have lifts to access. All Entry doors East, South and West into the Hydro are wide for easy access. Broad, flat, accessible concourse The venue has multiple accessible toilets and one fully equipped Changing Place with ceiling hoist, changing bed and height adjustable basin. Entry is by RADAR key visitors can use their own or ask a steward to unlock for them. The venue offers a wide range of additional accessibility services, such as sunflower lanyards, sensory packs, infra-red induction loop, etc. For more information visit the venue website at www.ovohydro.com

generalInfo.generalRule: The following policies apply to most events, but each event may differ, so please check the venue website event page for specific event policies. For full details of all venue policies see the venue website FAQs page. Searching and security All bags and visitors may be searched when entering the venue. Bags larger than A3 size (30cm x 42cm) are not permitted. Age Policies/Restrictions It is the recommendation of the venue that children under fourteen should not attend in the standing area at any event, unless accompanied by an adult. All patrons over five years old are welcome to attend in the seated section, unless otherwise stated by the event organiser. It is the venue's recommendation that children under five should not attend concerts or events, other than those specifically aimed at younger visitors, i.e. children's shows. Unless otherwise stated by the event organiser, the standard venue age advisory will apply. Exit and Re-Entry You may leave and re-enter the venue during the event, as long as you present your ticket for scanning each time. Cameras In general audio and video recording equipment and professional cameras (SLR types and those with detachable lenses) are not permitted into events. However, small non-professional cameras and phone cameras may be permitted, unless otherwise specified by the event organiser. Special Effects Special effects are used at many events and are controlled by the touring production team. If the use of certain effects concern you, or you would like further information on effects that may be used at a specific show, please email the venue. Other restrictions No food, drink, bottles or cans can be brought into the venue, other than for medical purposes (proof of need may be required). Please note that Level 2 rear and level 3 is accessible by stairs only and may not be suitable for those with mobility difficulties. May not be suitable for those who experience difficulty with heights or vertigo.
generalInfo.childRule: All children must have a valid ticket for an event, with the exception of 'babes in arms' (under 12 months) who may sit on a parent/guardian's knee, unless otherwise stated by the event promoter. Please check the age restrictions for each show. We have a small number of booster seats available to borrow for events in The OVO Hydro and SEC Armadillo. These are allocated on a first come first served basis and may be fully allocated at popular family events. If a booster seat is essential to your visit, we would encourage you to bring your own to avoid disappointment.

accessibility.info:
Wheelchair positions are for wheelchair users.

'Ambulant' positions are for patrons with disabilities/conditions that are unable to use general arena seating/standing.

Patrons requiring a hearing induction system or other services (BSL/Audio Description etc) should call the venue on 0141 576 3230 for more information.

The accessible ticket policy limits one free carer ticket to each accessible ticket purchased. If you need more than one essential companion or additional positions in your booking, please call the venue on 0141 576 3230.

By purchasing an accessible ticket, you confirm you or a member of your party require this position. Proof of eligibility/disability must be provided before the event - you will be contacted by Ticketmaster no later than 72 hours after your order.

Tickets may be cancelled if misuse is suspected/found.

promoters.description: SMG T-A FIRST DIRECT LEEDS / NTL / GBR

events.info: Venue and Event Info can be located here: https://www.firstdirectarena.com/yourevent/your-event/
events.pleaseNote: All timings are subject to change. Under 14s must be accompanied by an adult over 18. A max of nine tickets per person and per household applies. Tickets in excess of nine will be cancelled.

ticketLimit.info: Please note: There is a ticket Limit of 9 tickets per person and per credit card on this event

venues.name: First Direct Arena

boxOfficeInfo.openHoursDetail: The first direct arena on-site ticket office is located to the left hand side of the main entrance doors at the venue, past the first direct bar. On show days the ticket office will open no later than 1 hour before doors.
boxOfficeInfo.willCallDetail: If you are collecting tickets for the show, our venue box office will be open no later than 1 hour before doors. The box office is located to the left of the main entrance, just past the fd bar. Please allow yourself plenty of time to collect your tickets and to get into the venue, as there may be queues. Please take the credit card you booked with along with your Ticketmaster booking reference to collect your tickets. The box office will be open a minimum of 1 hour before doors open on the day of the show. Venue are happy for customers to collect in advance of show day as long as they are not duplicate tickets being collected.

venues.parkingDetail: There are over 7,500 car parking spaces within a 15 minute walk of the arena. The arena doesn't have its own car park however there are lots of options nearby. Q-Park offers first direct arena visitors exclusive discounted parking at a number of car parks within the city. Woodhouse Lane Car Park, located on Woodhouse Lane, offers 1272 spaces and easy access to the ring road at the end of the show. Merrion Centre Car Park, located on Merrion Way is adjacent to the Arena. It is our closest car park however visitors may experience delays leaving this location due to traffic restrictions on Merrion Way. None of the above car parks are operated by the arena so for questions, queries or comments we direct you to the above websites.
venues.accessibleSeatingDetail: first direct arena has been designed to be accessible to everyone for more information you can visit https://www.firstdirectarena.com/venue-information/accessibility/ All events are now setup up for online bookings via https://www.firstdirectarena.com/events/. For telephone bookings: 0800 988 4440 The ticket office will open no later than 1 hour before doors and will not be open for new shows going on sale. Additional Information If you have a specific question which has is not covered on the venues website please email - info@firstdirectarena.com

generalInfo.generalRule: No backpacks, holdalls, suitcases will be admitted into the venue. For the avoidance of doubt any bag with two shoulder straps that can be worn on the back will be classed as a backpack. This includes ladies handbags. You are permitted to bring small bags or handbags no larger than 35cm x 40cm x 19cm. All remaining bags will be searched. Patrons will be refused entry if they attempt to enter the venue with the prohibited item. Patrons with accessible and medical requirements/equipment will be considered on an individual basis but encouraged to contact the venue in advance for ease of entry. There will be no temporary storage facilities for such items within the venue and it will be left to the patron to find a safe temporary facility to hold the item. The venue will not be responsible for late admission or non-admission as a result of this policy. Smoking areas are located on Level 2 of the Arena, at either ends of the concourses away from the main stairs. Unfortunately for Health and Safety reasons, there will not be an opportunity for the general public to leave and re-enter the venue. A strict policy of no re-admission to the venue will be enforced. Electronic cigarettes are not permitted for use inside, due to the sophistication of these devices, it is increasingly difficult to identify guests in the auditorium smoking compared to those smoking electronic cigarettes. To assist with this, guests who wish to use these devices are requested to use the external smoking areas. Public safety continues to be the venue’s priority. They are doing all they can to keep you safe at the venue. Please remember they do not permit backpacks or large bags and you will be screened upon arrival.
generalInfo.childRule: There are no age restrictions to any shows, unless requested by the visiting artist, however we request that no children under 14 come unaccompanied and we also advise that no under 14s go on the floor for standing floor shows. Please be aware that during concerts people may stand up.

ada.adaPhones:
Please e-mail access@ticketmaster.co.uk with your request and any specific requirements (please note all requests subject to availability).

All events are now setup up for online bookings via Ticketmaster or https://www.firstdirectarena.com/events/.

Please take the credit card you booked with along with your Ticketmaster booking reference to collect your tickets. The box office will be open a minimum of 1 hour before doors open on the day of the show. Venue are happy for customers to collect in advance of show day as long as they are not duplicate tickets being collected.

venues.parkingDetail: There are over 7,500 car parking spaces within a 15 minute walk of the arena. The arena doesn't have its own car park however there are lots of options nearby. Q-Park offers first direct arena visitors exclusive discounted parking at a number of car parks within the city. Woodhouse Lane Car Park, located on Woodhouse Lane, offers 1272 spaces and easy access to the ring road at the end of the show. Merrion Centre Car Park, located on Merrion Way is adjacent to the Arena. It is our closest car park however visitors may experience delays leaving this location due to traffic restrictions on Merrion Way. None of the above car parks are operated by the arena so for questions, queries or comments we direct you to the above websites.
venues.accessibleSeatingDetail: first direct arena has been designed to be accessible to everyone for more information you can visit https://www.firstdirectarena.com/venue-information/accessibility/ All events are now setup up for online bookings via https://www.firstdirectarena.com/events/. For telephone bookings: 0800 988 4440 The ticket office will open no later than 1 hour before doors and will not be open for new shows going on sale. Additional Information If you have a specific question which has is not covered on the venues website please email - info@firstdirectarena.com

generalInfo.generalRule: No backpacks, holdalls, suitcases will be admitted into the venue. For the avoidance of doubt any bag with two shoulder straps that can be worn on the back will be classed as a backpack. This includes ladies handbags. You are permitted to bring small bags or handbags no larger than 35cm x 40cm x 19cm. All remaining bags will be searched. Patrons will be refused entry if they attempt to enter the venue with the prohibited item. Patrons with accessible and medical requirements/equipment will be considered on an individual basis but encouraged to contact the venue in advance for ease of entry. There will be no temporary storage facilities for such items within the venue and it will be left to the patron to find a safe temporary facility to hold the item. The venue will not be responsible for late admission or non-admission as a result of this policy. Smoking areas are located on Level 2 of the Arena, at either ends of the concourses away from the main stairs. Unfortunately for Health and Safety reasons, there will not be an opportunity for the general public to leave and re-enter the venue. A strict policy of no re-admission to the venue will be enforced. Electronic cigarettes are not permitted for use inside, due to the sophistication of these devices, it is increasingly difficult to identify guests in the auditorium smoking compared to those smoking electronic cigarettes. To assist with this, guests who wish to use these devices are requested to use the external smoking areas. Public safety continues to be the venue’s priority. They are doing all they can to keep you safe at the venue. Please remember they do not permit backpacks or large bags and you will be screened upon arrival.
generalInfo.childRule: There are no age restrictions to any shows, unless requested by the visiting artist, however we request that no children under 14 come unaccompanied and we also advise that no under 14s go on the floor for standing floor shows. Please be aware that during concerts people may stand up.

ada.adaPhones:
Please e-mail access@ticketmaster.co.uk with your request and any specific requirements (please note all requests subject to availability).

All events are now setup up for online bookings via Ticketmaster or https://www.firstdirectarena.com/events/.
